style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Arcadia Ales
breweries.description:
Arcadia Ales was established in 1996 as a microbrewery specializing in handcrafted British-style ales. All of our beers are produced in small batches, and our 25 Barrel Peter Austin Brewery and methods originated in England, which allows this style of beer to reflect over 250 years of world class brewing heritage.

In addition to brewing on authentic British equipment, Arcadia uses only the finest malted barley from England, and when combined with the freshest hops from the Pacific Northwest of our United States, and our legendary Ringwood yeast, the result is some of the best and freshest handcrafted ales available, on any continent.

data.name: Something Red
data.description:
2007 Maryland Governor's Cup Winner!
 This one has something for everyone. A deep copper colored ale with just the right amount of malt to complement the dosing of hops. A true beer lover's beer.

data.name: Something Reddy
data.description: What do you get when you mix a red ale with a unique blend of tea and honey? Something Reddy!! Blood Orange tea is mixed with a complex recipe of malts with apple, beetroot, orange peel, rose hips, orange pieces, hibiscus, safflowers and honey that help create a distinctive beer. One taste will leave your pallet demanding more!

data.name: South Ridge Amber
data.description:
Our second release in cans, South Ridge is an American amber ale, much like an American pale ale, but darker in color, with more caramel flavor, more body and slightly more balance between hop bitterness and malt.  With its combination of smooth bitterness, malt, hop flavors and aromas and a slightly dry finish, it is an eminently drinkable beer. 
The label for South Ridge is a caricature of the ridge south of the brewery.  The origin of the name "South Ridge" came from Wally, Kristy's late father, who was a famous Boulder golf coach (he coached Hale Irwin in high school).  In those days, Wally used to bring his golfers up here and they practiced driving by hitting balls up the South Ridge - hence the "fairway."  The label is purposely made using a little tongue-in-cheek because Wally was a guy who liked his students to enjoy learning.  He liked to have fun.  So do we.  Here’s to you Wally.
data.foodPairings: Any food that isn't sweet: sandwiches, hearty soups and pizzas. Also a good thirst-quencher for barbecue or Mexican food.

breweries.name: Crystal Springs Brewing Co
breweries.description: We make good beer, plain and simple. If you are looking for unique, small batch beers painstakingly created under the watchful eyes and hands of our brew master, look no further. You have found something unique to pour into your favorite glass. Our brewery is named after the original Crystal Springs Brewing and Ice Company, founded in 1875 in Boulder, Colorado. We brew craft beer you must try. Each of our beers begin with a simple theme: to create memorable beers - ones that our customers will savor and want to share with close friends. Drinking great beer is our aspiration, making great beer is our passion.

data.name: Southern Delight Praline Amber Ale
data.description: Our Praline Amber Ale is brewed with a generous addition of Georgia Pecans and Madagascar vanilla. We also add lactose to accentuate the natural caramel flavors from the malt. These additions combine to produce a flavor reminiscent of a traditional Southern candy, the praline.

Live Without Boundaries.

Man needs job. Man finds a job. Man finds a passion in that job.
That passion becomes a life mission written on a napkin (own a brewery by age 30.)
That mission becomes:
THE UNKNOWN BREWING COMPANY.

data.name: Spokamber Ale
data.description: Spokamber is an easy drinking amber ale. It's the perfect start for someone new to microbrews as it has a smooth malty finish. Spokamber is a great local beer at an affordable price.

breweries.name: Budge Brothers Brewery
breweries.description:
Brad and Bruce Budge are the owners/operators of Budge Bros Brewery in Spokane, WA. The idea of opening a brewery came to us in the spring of 2007, when we were both working as cooks in Spokane. At the time we were 18 and 21 years old. One spring day, we made the decision to quit our jobs and start a brewery. Shortly after that, we bought our first homebrew kit and brewed our first few batches. We knew that this is what we wanted to do with our lives. Our family encouraged us and helped us gather enough equipment to open our brewery. We became licensed to sell beer in Washington in January of 2010. We opened our new location and taproom at 2018 E Riverside Ave, Suite #1 in Spokane in May of 2011. We take pride in brewing quality beers made with the freshest ingredients around. All of our brews also contain a special touch of “Budge Bros Magic”. We have many exciting plans for the future, including an exclusive “Plastic Cup Club”, special events at the Taproom, seasonal brews, and cool new merchandise. We also serve the best Popcorn in the Greater Spokane Area.

While you’re here, feel free to poke around and check out the types of beer we brew. Don’t be afraid to take a look at us and see some of our videos, photos, and games created for your enjoyment. If you are looking to find our brews at other spots in Spokane, check out this page, and if you want to see us in your favorite pub, tavern, or bar don’t hesitate to let us know.

breweries.name: Andwells Brewery
breweries.description:
Andwell Brewing Company is a true family business, run by Adam Komrower and his wife, Helen.  Andwell’s brewed its first beer in October 2008. Since then, Andwell’s has established a reputation for consistently producing beers of the highest quality

Andwell's run guided Brewery Tours where you can discover some of the secrets of brewing, touch and taste the floor-malted hand-raked barley, take in the sweet aroma of hops and sample some of Hampshire’s finest beers.

data.name: St. Anne's Amber Ale
data.description: An American Amber ale that combines medium hop bitterness with a pleasant malt backbone. Hopped exclusively with galena hops. This Amber ale is well balanced, making it a very session-able beer.

breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company
breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.

breweries.name: St. George Brewing Company
breweries.description: From humble beginnings as a "Brew on Premises" BOP establishment located in a store-front in a strip mall in Virginia Beach in 1991, B. A. Brewmeister has come of age as a brewery of craft beers with its 'brew haus' and 'celler' sharing a 10,000 square foot facility located at 204 Challenger Way in Hampton, Virginia. B.A. Brewmeister currently trades as The St. George Brewing Company & Olde Richmond Ale Company.

data.name: St. Michaels Ale
data.description:
A dark amber ale brewed with Carmel and Munich malts.  Medium bodied with an off white head and balanced with Willamette and Saaz hops.  Smooth toffee/carmel malt flavor in the front and finishes clean with a spicy bite.  

Silver Medal Winner: Maryland Governor's Cup 2010

breweries.name: Eastern Shore Brewing Co
breweries.description:
Eastern Shore Brewing opened it's doors September of 2008 by owners Adrian and Lori Moritz.  Both had an entrepanerial passion, but never thought of a microbrewery as their business.  "The decision was made for us.  Make a business out of something you love to do and you will never work another day in your life" the couple states.  A lot of hard work and a love for good beer motivates the business. 
We decided to open Eastern Shore Brewing after talking with friends from St. Michael's Winery, and were told that the town was in need of a microbrewery.  After some discussion (less than you may think), we agreed and were on our way.  With some trials along the way in year one, year two proved to be the pinicle of change.  An increase in brewery size promoted an increase of staff.  Randall Marquis came on board as brewmaster in March of 2009 and has made his presence known.  An undergratudate of Franklin Marshall College, and a brewing certificate holder from UC Davis, Randy is a large portion of the success of Eastern Shore Brewing.  Three beers took home medals in the Maryland Govenor's cup competition (Bronze for Lighthause Golden Ale, Silver for the Duck Duck Goose Porter and a Silver for the St.ichael's Amber ALe) on October 9th.  And although happy with the medals, Eastern Shore Brewing's goals are to continue to grow the busines and improve their products.  Distribution ranges from Cambridge to Kent Island on the Eastern Shore of Maryland, and recently moved into Ellicott City, Maryland.  A new fermenter will be arriving shortly after the new year, which will increase capacity even further.
There is more to come....

data.name: Star Belly
data.description: Amber Hybrid was originally a California Common, but after a late addition of cascade hops, some darker roasted malts, higher temperatures in open fermentation tanks, and reduced yeast cell counts, we ended up creating this incredibly complex and easy drinking masterpiece.

breweries.name: Brenner Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Brenner Brewing Co. is a microbrewery in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Founder, Mike Brenner was awarded the title Master Brewer after completing a rigorous international training program at the Siebel Institute and the Doemens Akademie. Every aspect of the brewery includes the founders lifelong commitment to supporting local art and music.

Brenner's passion for crafting delicious beer and his lifelong devotion to Milwaukee's arts and music scene, has led to the creation of Brenner Brewing's "12 Ounce Ambassadors." Each style of beer features the artwork of a local artist and comes with a soundtrack featuring the music of local bands. As Brenner Brewing's distribution expands so does the awareness of Milwaukee's incredible arts scene.

Brenner also opened a 25,000 sq ft arts incubator in the building with the brewery which features a 2,000 sq ft contemporary art gallery and 20 artists' studio spaces. Come visit the brewery, tasting room, and art gallery soon.

breweries.name: Liberal Cup Public House and Brewery
breweries.description:
The Liberal Cup Public House and Brewery opened its doors in Hallowell in 2000. Since then, we’ve developed a following who truly appreciates our brews and food in a comfortable atmosphere. As the name suggests, we believe in quanity as well as quality. Whether it’s one of our standard 20oz pints or a heaping plate of Fish and Chips, we guarantee you won’t leave our pub thirsty or hungry.

Beer holds a special place in our hearts and minds; it’s our life mission to pour you the perfect pint. Throughout the year we produce 21 different ales and lagers, each one with a distinct character. We run the gamut from a Pilsner to a Cask-Conditioned Bitter to an Oatmeal Stout. You’ll have to drop in to see what’s on tap at any given time, because 115 Water Street is the only place in the world you’ll find our brews. As we like to say: “Brewed in Hallowell, Drunk in Hallowell”.

If for some silly reason your friends don’t drink beer, we also have a full wine and liquor selection. And because everyone likes to eat, we produce loads of fresh, home-made meals that appeal to all appetites. So, please come visit us and enjoy all the charm of an English pub, without the hassle of going through customs.

data.name: State Budget Red Ale
data.description: A red-hued beer that combines some of our IPA's hoppiness with the strong malt backbone of Alewife Ale.

breweries.name: Run of the Mill Public House and Brewery
breweries.nameShortDisplay: Run of the Mill Public House
breweries.description:
The Run of the Mill Public House & Brewery is a 14 barrel brew pub specializing in hand-crafted beer and casual pub fare. All of our beers flow directly from our brewery.  We use only the finest imported malts and domestic hops available to bring you the tastiest and finest selection of beers.

Owner Geoff Houghton renovated an abandoned Mill and made it a place where business men and women meet, families gather and friends hang out.

In addition to our house-made beers, we have an eclectic Pub menu featuring home made food. Our talented chefs serve delightful appetizers, wraps, sandwiches, vegetarian fare, hearty entrees and imaginative daily specials.  Come in make yourself at home and enjoy a fresh brew and meal.
We are located on Saco Island in Saco Maine.  From Memorial Day to Labor Day come enjoy our outdoor seating and bar overlooking the Saco River, we offer a grill menu and raw bar.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

data.name: Steep Trail Amber Ale
data.description:
Our Steep Trail Amber Ale is a medium copper-colored brew with a rich full malt character. At various stages in the brewing process, we introduce several varieties of British Noble hops to complement the natural sweetness of the finest English Pale and Crystal malts to produce a deliciously creamy brew with hints of toffee, plums and hazelnuts.

In the style of traditional British Special Bitters, our Amber Ale is a beer of great finesse and balance; it pairs well with roasted meats, full flavored fish, chili and any sturdy cheese. Try it the next time you barbecue!

Steep Trail Amber Ale is available in bottles and kegs at discerning retailers, pubs and restaurants throughout Northern California and Nevada.`

breweries.name: Black Diamond Brewing Company
breweries.description: Unwind after a day on the slopes or, more likely, a day in the office, with a hand-crafted Black Diamond brew at our Concord brewing facility. Your taste buds will immediately appreciate the finest of ingredients that go into making our exceptionally refreshing and flavorful beers, and you will feel right at home in our welcoming Tap Room. Sample some of our famous ales and enjoy a tour of our brewery - you will quickly realize why our seasoned Brewmaster is a multiple award-winning brewer. You have worked hard. Give yourself a break. Let Black Diamond Brewing help you and your friends dial down from a day of 'shredding' on the slopes or at the office.

They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Lion Brewery
breweries.description:
With a proud brewing heritage dating back to 1905, The Lion Brewery merges rustic architecture with state-of-the-art brewing technology, a contrast typified by the gleaming stainless steel aging tanks that sit alongside the traditional copper brew kettle. Our brewing process utilizes the traditional English method of upward infusion mashing in our combination mash lauter tun to create lagers and ales inspired by old world values, but with modern quality and consistency. The staff at The Lion Brewery is dedicated to producing true handcrafted beers, made right here in our century-old Brewhouse. All of our premium beers are made using only the four basic ingredients allowed by the Reinheitsgebot, or German purity law. Under the skillful supervision of our Master Brewer, Leo Orlandini, each of our lagers and ales are brewed in small batches using only the finest hops and malts available to guarantee the highest quality and freshness. Each product we brew is an original recipe especially created to deliver a fuller flavor than ordinary beers, yet with an approachable style and character. As a result, our beers have garnered numerous medals from the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Championships in recent years.

In 1974 the Lion Brewing Company bought the Stegmaier Brand.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Hop Valley Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Founded in February, 2009, Hop Valley is the first craft brewery in Springfield, OR.  With a 15 barrel system and a restaurant that compliments the fine hand crafted beer, Hop Valley has grown into one of Springfield's largest businesses.  Distributing beer throughout the Western States.
Based on that success, and significant pent up demand for their beer, Hop Valley opened a new facility at 990 W.1st Ave in Eugene at which they have built a new, much larger, 60 barrel production brewery.  This facility will be capable of producing up to 100,000 barrels per year, in stark contrast to the system in Springfield, that is maxed out at about 4000 barrels produced in 2012.
Our state of the art equipment and the facility are all built with every opportunity toward a green foot print, including the most efficient lighting, boiler, solar heating, etc.. available today.
The new facility has a large tasting room and outdoor patio and also has limited food service, to allow customers to enjoy all of our craft brews in a very comfortable setting, and with enough parking and outdoor area to support large parties!

breweries.name: Lawson's Finest Liquids
breweries.description: Lawson’s Finest Liquids, LLC is based in Warren, Vermont and distributes small, custom batches of unique beer through their exclusive wholesale distributor, The Beer Guy, LLC. Sean Lawson, founder and brewer, has been an avid home brewer for nearly twenty years, with numerous award winning recipes. Lawson’s Finest, with a small batch system, can custom craft specialty beers for establishments and events. Limited in availability by design, these rare beers can only be found near the Mad River Valley of Vermont.

breweries.name: The Gem and Keystone
breweries.description:
We are proud to offer a twist on the classic brewpub; serving handcrafted ales and lagers brewed on premises, providing “food lovers dining” which emphasizes a seasonal menu using local and sustainable ingredients and consistently delivering exceptional service. What more can you ask for?

Also known as Shawnee Craft Brewery

data.name: Stock Amber Ale
data.description: Crafted from American ingredients, this deep copper ale is anchored by a strong malt backbone containing subtly delicious hints of caramel and fruit. This Forest City staple has a medium intensity hop flavor with citrus hop notes. A frothy headed classic that is sure to find its’ way into your stomach and into your cooler!

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. breweries.name: Forest City Brewery
breweries.description:
Four guys who
love great beer.

We want to share our love for great beer with you! We are just four regular guys starting a local business.

Our concept is simple: Rebuild an old Cleveland brewery on the grounds of one of Cleveland's oldest beer gardens in Duck Island, a part of Cleveland's Brewery District.

The brewery will include a brewpub, located in a timber frame warehouse, built in 1915 on the site of the Silberg Brothers Beer Garden (1880-1900). Part of the beer garden area still exists, so we will also rebuild the beer garden.  The beer hall, beer garden & brewery will feel like you are walking into a 19th Century brewery.

The original Forest City Brewery operated from 1839-1880 at the location where the Hard Rock Café in Cleveland now resides.  The new version will have the look and feel of the old version, with solid oak, turn of the century ice boxes, a bar made from architectural salvaged timber and beer hall tables made from salvaged wood from one of the homes (built in 1880) on the property slated for demolition.

data.name: Stone Levitation Ale
data.description: We're best known for brewing aggressive, big-character beers, but we love a great sessionable ale as much as anyone. Most beers at the less-weighty end of the spectrum lack flavor and depth as much as they lack high ABVs, but not Stone Levitation Ale! This deep amber brew has a rich maltiness, big hoppy character, citrus overtones, and an impressively modest alcohol content for a beer with so much flavor packed into it.

breweries.name: Stone Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Founded by Greg Koch and Steve Wagner in 1996, San Diego-based Stone Brewing Co. is the 10th largest craft brewer in the United States. Stone has been listed on the Inc. 500 | 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies list nine times, and has been called the “All-time Top Brewery on Planet Earth” by BeerAdvocate magazine twice. The multi-faceted company will be the first American craft brewer to independently own and operate facilities in Berlin, Germany and also has plans to open operations east of the Mississippi. Known for its bold, flavorful and largely hop-centric beers, Stone has earned a reputation for brewing outstanding, unique beers while maintaining an unwavering commitment to sustainability, business ethics, philanthropy and the art of brewing.

locations.name: Stone Brewing World Bistro & Gardens - Liberty Station

data.name: Stony Face Red Ale
data.description: Not everyone likes lots of hops. Who knew? This beer is our "What do you have that's not bitter?" offering. Don't let the dark color fool you, Stony Face is very drinkable.

breweries.name: Heavy Seas Beer
breweries.description:
Heavy Seas Beer is brewed by Clipper City Brewing Company, in Baltimore, Maryland. The brewery was established by Hugh Sisson in 1995. Previously, Sisson operated Maryland's first brewpub, Sisson's. The brewery is named for the famed Clipper ship - first developed and built in the home port of Baltimore. While the name of the company remains Clipper City Brewing Company, all of its beer falls under the Heavy Seas brand. Heavy Seas is located at 4615 Hollins Ferry Road, Suite B, in the Halethorpe section of Baltimore. Heavy Seas currently offers a variety of beer styles in approx. 18 states within the United States.

Heavy Seas mission is to bring back the local brewery, and to do it in such a way that we are more than just a fringe player, but a positive part of our area. To accomplish this mission we have created a broad portfolio of products with enough diversity that we have at least one beer that can appeal to everyone. Whether your preference is for a classic American style lager beer, or a big, challenging Hop Cubed Ale, we have a something that will suit your taste. We believe in bringing beer drinkers the quality and flavor of a handcrafted beer while supporting the local communities we serve.

breweries.name: Union Craft Brewing Company
breweries.description: Union Craft Brewing is a homegrown, independent craft brewery located in the Clipper Mill area of Woodberry. We are dedicated to providing the good people of Baltimore fresh, handcrafted, and approachable beers and to fostering the community that forms whenever great beer is flowing.

data.name: Storm Cat
data.description: Mosaic hops give Storm Cat (a stud Thoroughbred who had a 24-hour armed guard for his, talents) a grapefruit and tangerine essence with a residual sweetness from caramel malts.

We are a small microbrewery located south of Chicago, in Lansing Illinois.  Our tasting room serves eight different selections of our hand-crafted beer.
Our beer won't make you strong or handsome, but if you appreciate craft beer and want to meet some guys that are happy to make it, serve it, and probably drink it with you, stop by or give us a call

breweries.name: Stoup Brewing
breweries.description:
Stoup Brewing – The Art and Science of Beer

At Stoup, our craftsmanship is a testament to our commitment to the art and the science of beer. As scientists, we hold the microorganisms and chemical processes that create beer in the highest esteem. As artists, we revel in a good pour. The dual disposition honors traditional styles perfected by earlier brew-masters as well as elevates craft brewing by continually seeking a better pint.

Our brewery will communicate a respect for both the art and science of beer by cultivating a warm and communal environment – a place for friends to gather and for enthusiasts to chat with the brewers over a well-fashioned, delicious beer.

breweries.name: Angry Hank's Microbrewery
breweries.description:
Old time service station turned brewpub, Angry Hanks is in very close proximity to the other brewpubs in town, making it very easy for a pubcrawl. With garage doors that open onto their wood-fenced patio, Angry Hanks has a unique service station ambience. 

Head brewer, Mohr worked at Red Lodge Ales for five years before moving to Billings and opening his own brewery. Providing outstanding selection and quality with 8 ales on tap including Anger Management Belgian-style Wheat, Angry Hank's Blonde, Street Fight Imperial Red, Dog Slobber Brown and Head Trauma IPA as well as seasonal beers.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. breweries.name: Isle of Purbeck Brewery
breweries.description:
Established in 2003, the award winning Isle of Purbeck Brewery started brewing at the gateway to Dorsets world heritage Jurassic coast, nestled in the Purbeck Hills overlooking the clear blue sea of Studland Bay.
Building on the success of our renowned Fossil Fuel under the expert guidance of master brewer Dan Thomasson, Jack, Pippa and the IOPB team have grown the range to 5 core beers, encompassing a delicious spectrum of styles and tastes.
Our approach to making the beer has always been straightforward. First of all we make it all by hand in the traditional way, that way we make sure each part of the brew is perfect. Secondly we dont cut any corners on ingredients.
We use the best that England can provide. And last but not least, we aim to provide exceptional personal service in the finest traditions of a family run brewery.

data.name: Sunbird Red Ale
data.description: A classic Irish Red, this beer represents the finest in Irish brewing traditions, and is our homage to the greats that have come before us...and those large brewing kings we seek to dethrone.  Our Red Ale has a fullness that softens the heart on a cold winter’s eve. In the summertime, enjoy one straight from the fridge and taste the sharp German hops softened by the sweetness of our crystal malt. The well-rounded flavor will carry you back to the happy memories of those sunny summer days.

breweries.name: Irish Yankee
breweries.description: After spending years pretending we knew beer, and dreaming of working for ourselves, drinking beer and living the American dream, we decided to take the plunge in Ireland.  With our new favorite Irish friend, we set out to create a brewery that captures the spirit of Ireland's rich brewing history, the flavor of the Irish countryside and our American spirit and hustle.

data.name: Sunday Funday Red Ale
data.description: TGIF? Not at South Fork! This red ale was brewed with the end of the weekend in mind. The beer has a rich mahogany color and smooth caramel flavor with a slight amount of hops that lingers long after you’ve left your friend’s patio!

breweries.name: New Holland Brewing Company
breweries.description:
New Holland Brewing Company’s deep roots in the craft industry go back to 1997. Our role as an integral member of the artisan approach is something we take seriously, yet engage lightheartedly.

We believe the art of craft lives in fostering rich experiences for our customers, through creating authentic beer, spirits and food while providing great service. Recognized for our creativity and artistry, our mission to improve the lives of craft consumers everywhere is seen in our diverse, balanced collection of beer and spirits.

data.name: Sunset Ale
data.description: Two Birds Sunset Ale is brewed using a distinct combination of malts, including pale, wheat and Crystal malts to provide round, rich, toffee notes. The addition of US Citra and Australian Cascade hops adds a twist of grapefruit and and tropical notes to balance the biscuity malt base.

data.name: Sunset Amber Ale
data.description: Distinctive. Exotic. Satisfying. This ale washes over your palate with a flash of bitter chocolate and an aroma of green woods. Medium-bodied with an exotic aroma and malt background accented by moderate bitterness. Enhances rich pupus and barbecue dishes. Great with fragrant, spicy food. Try it with Portuguese Bean Soup.

breweries.name: Hawai'i Nui Brewing
breweries.description:
At Hawai‘i Nui Brewing, we’re passionate about craft beer. We brew small batches of our all-natural ales and lagers from the finest barley malt, wheat, hops and yeast.  We are committed to local production in Hawai‘i.  

Our uniquely well balanced Island Style beer is perfect for your time in Paradise!

What is Island Style? To those of us who call Hawai’i home, it’s all about balance. Working hard, sure. But when pau hana time comes, it’s about friends and family. Heeding the call of the sun and sand, surf and sea. Tasting freshness. Celebrating music. Stopping at sunset. Resting easy at night. Appreciating life’s detours–what we call holo holo time. Living life as it should be.

data.name: Sunset Amber Ale
data.description: Our amber Ale has a blend of German, United Kingdom, and Canadian medium roast crystal malts along with rich Munich and pale malts give our amber complex color and sweetness. Cascade hops help tame the sweetness of this ale.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: The Victor Brewery
breweries.description: A microbrewery celebrating hand-crafted beer.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm
Sat: 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

data.name: Sunset Amber Ale
data.description:
This copper colored American Amber Ale has a malty flavor with a clean, dry finish. Hopped with mostly Amarillo hops, the beer has a wonderful floral/citrus aroma and flavor. 

This is a classic West Coast Amber Ale.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
